alfredsnippet.snippet:
https://physics.aps.org/articles/v6/131

"In Physical Review Letters, Forrest Mozer at the University of California, Berkeley, and colleagues [1] report the first in situ observations in the radiation belts of streams of thousands of 'double layers'-moving sheets of separated positive and negative charge that have long been thought to accelerate electrons. Data from NASA's Van Allen probes show an astonishing potential drop (voltage difference) of a million volts passing the satellites, in streams that appear in association with strong enhancements of 2.52.5-MeV electron fluxes ..."

(cont'd)
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Magnetic Reconnection or Plasma Double Layers? - Part 1
